sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"手套"之意。
means: glove ： 指普通分成5指的手套。
mitten ： 指拇指分开而其余4指连在一起的手套。

sentence.Network_en: There is a hole in the thumb of his mitten.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的手套的拇指上有个洞.

sentence.Network_en: One red mitten lying lost under a poplar tree.
sentence.Network_cn: 一只红色小猫迷惘地躺在白杨树下.

sentence.Network_en: She has given her ex - boyfriend the mitten and married an old man.
sentence.Network_cn: 她拒绝她以前的男朋友而嫁给了一个老头子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French mitaine, perhaps from mite pet name for a cat (because mittens were often made of fur)

entry.def: Mittens are gloves which have one section that covers your thumb and another section that covers your four fingers together.

means.word_mean: 1. glove that encases the thumb separately and the other four fingers together

auth_sentence.content: He rubbed a thick mitten across his face.

sentences.en: Cotton mittens will prevent the baby from scratching his own face.
sentences.cn: 棉的连指手套使婴儿不会抓伤自己的脸。
